âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept the contribution cuz i like it XD

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: A territory-taking game would be good.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's time to take the lion's share of the game board
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

i think it would be a good idea to say how is the conquered score calculated... add in 'Game over condition' something like:

"Your conquered score is the number of reachable cells in your domain."
wow, im just doing this for xp :)
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Hi,
great game. One small suggestion:

Usually, when I try a new game I always press "Play my code" just to see what happens and what will the default bot do. In your implementation this does not work, since in the second move "0 0 R" is illegal and stops the game. 

Please consider making illegal move being ignored so the game can continue even if one player plays an illegal move or implement "WAIT".
Love the game.  Would make a great table top game (if it doesn't already exist)

Bot also finished (somewhat) with a design similar to MSmits's. It's fast but I have the feeling that my eval sucks. It destroys the random bots but is definitely weaker than MSmits's. I'll wait for approval and more games to improve on it.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
je suis alluciner par se travailler
Good code but  you could add the count  to each player of how many moves are left  until the finish.

Almost there but the protocol still needs some improvements. In the current version, there is no way to know at startup if you are the first or second player. You have to wait until the first time in the game loop to have this information.
I suggest the following changes: width, height, id (0 or 1)  in the first input line. The next two input lines do not change but are interpreted as first and second player initial positions.

Finished my bot:

- MCTS with eval instead of random sim.
- Uses voronoi eval
- MCTS solver to solve the game
- a little over 50k Rollouts (eval expanded node only)

An example:

https://www.codingame.com/replay/811528274

Games are relatively long. I don't think the game is too simple for CG constraints. This would be a hard game to solve, which is good. 

I am not sure about player 1 advantage. It could be large... or not at all. Need more bots!

Comment to keep track of new changes
- Borders are now considered as true walls, hence it's not buildable
- Illegal move will now lose you the game instead of having the referee to fix it
- Some changes with the input format, statement is now updated.
Regarding borders and walls, it would be more logical if borders were considered as true walls ie not buildable
Regarding the inputs, why not describing walls the same way as outputs, ie cell + direction ? I feel it's much more consistent

Regarding expert rules, the usual behaviour on most CG multis is that any invalid input like going too far or building on an existing wall should result in a immediate loss with a corresponding error message rather than trying to fix the input.

I just stumbled on your game. I like it. Is it an original design ?
You should consider adding numbers for rows and columns on the left and bottom of your grid.

Rules
* Suggest to change "happens in" to "is played on".

* Suggest to change "sovereign" to "token" (all instances).

* Where is the cell with the coordinates (0, 0)? Is it the top-left corner of the board, or the bottom-left one?

* It sounds like each move must be in a single direction. The directions are not really necessary, because only the destination coordinates are required to be output. Suggest to change the *FIRST* sentence of "Movements" to:

During a player's turn, the player may either keep their token in its current location, or move it to another cell up to 3 steps away (measured in Manhattan distance).

* Suggest to change "a cell with" to "a cell occupied by".

* Please change "map" to "board" (twice).

* It sounds like a player can only build a wall after moving their token. Suggest to change the *FIRST* sentence of "Wall building" to:

After completing their move â€“ or choosing not to move â€“ the player must build a wall on any side of their token: <const>U</const>p, <const>D</const>own, <const>L</const>eft, or <const>R</const>ight.

* Please change "of both parties" to "player's token".

* Please change "another wall" to "an existing wall".

* Suggest to change "see what will happen" to "learn what happens".

* Please change "attempted" to "attempt".

* Suggest to change "do it" to "do so".

* Suggest to change "one player can never" to "neither player can".

* Please change "reach to" to "reach".

* What does this mean? "Note that the rule with player blocking a cell by standing on it does not count in this condition."

Say, if a player builds four walls to block off all the sides where their token is located, then it should still be a "game over" because neither player can reach the other playerâ€¦?

* Please add the sections of Victory Conditions and Defeat Conditions. Please check out the HTML source of any bot programming games for an example.

Expert Rules
* Please change "another" to "an".

* Please change "wall build" to "wall building".

* Please change "there's an empty space" to "an available side is found".

Example
* Is this section required, or can it be removed?

Note
* Is this section required, or can it be removed?

Initial input
* Please add "Two space-separated integers" before "width".

Input
* Line 1: Please add "2 space-separated integers".

* Line 1: Please change "your position" to "the position of your token".

* Line 2: Please add "2 space-separated integers".

* Line 2: Please change "opponent's position" to "the position of your opponent's token".

* Line 3: Please add "An integer".

* Next numWalls lines:

  â€¢ Please add "4 space-separated integers".
  
  â€¢ Please change "both" to "the".

  â€¢ Please change "on top or on the left" to "above or to the left".

Output
* Please change "the cell you wish to go to" to "the position of the cell you wish to move your token to (or its current position if not moving)".

* Please delete "after moving to x y" because a token may not necessarily move.

Thanks.

This error is occurring.
Shouldn't there be a time limit?


The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Total game duration too long (>30000ms)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.addTurnTime(GameManager.java:582)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.execute(GameManager.java:192)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.execute(GameManager.java:226)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.AbstractPlayer.execute(AbstractPlayer.java:101)
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.kt:60)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:67)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:50)
Thanks, I'm not aware of the total game duration limit.

Helpful corrections as always, thanks.

> Suggest to change "sovereign" to "token" (all instances).
I guess I will put it as token before I find a suitable sprite.

> The directions are not really necessary
I emphasize on the steps because of walls, there will be cases where the cell seem to be within 3-step Manhattan distance yet still unreachable due to a wall blocking it.

> What does this mean?
https://imgur.com/a/Zb3izkh
This is just an extreme example, but in blue's POV, even though blue seems to be completely trapped, due to the "body block" rule, when accounting for the winning conditions, both players should be strictly isolated by walls, hence what I'm trying to express there, "body block" rule does not apply, so in that case blue still gets a turn and is forced to commit suicide. So, how could I've phrased it better?

> Say, if a player builds four walls to block off all the sides where their token is located, then it should still be a "game over" because neither player can reach the other playerâ€¦?
Precisely

> Please delete "after moving to x y" because a token may not necessarily move.
I just want to emphasize on the fact that the wall build action is AFTER the move, but I guess the statement before already made it clear enough.
Thanks. Unfortunately, this game is not my original idea, I learned it from a TV show and figured it would be perfect for codingame. I would definitely consider adding the coordinates.
I'm aware of that, it's just that while implementing I realise fixing the input would be much easier than throwing an error resulting in some ugly nested try-catch ðŸ˜…. I will change it if needed.

It's great to know that you are enjoying it! It's my pleasure to bring fun and unique games to top players like yourself. I'm also intrigued to see how a good game will play out.

Regarding on the illegal move, it might not be stated in the statement, but the border is now considered as true wall, and it's considered illegal to build on top of it. I have another comment dedicated to update of new rules that I have yet to put in the statement, hope this helps.

Did a couple of games. My bot is very deterministic with only 1 param (exploration), I can vary to get different games. Both players win from time to time, but it's still poor statistics.  I also found a draw:

https://www.codingame.com/replay/811529478
I can easily add that, but don't mind if I ask, what can a player possibly do with that information?
If this information can be really computed (which I sincerely doubt), it is anyway irrelevant for writing a bot.
Join the party !

Hi, thanks for the comment, and sorry for the awfully late response, was kinda busy.

Last time, the game is actually more forgiving, the referee will actually fix your wall placement if you placed a direction with a wall already occupied, and will let you stay in place if you try to move to somewhere out of range. But apparently it's not normal to have this feature, so I changed it.

I personally don't like a "WAIT" move. I much prefer to have a system that will force the player to make a move every single turn, which in my opinion what makes this game interesting. In some moves where wall placement is not the main goal, players still have to figure out the most optimal "waiting" wall placement to not mess up future planning.

The best I can do to fulfil your wish is to provide a random command, which can easily allow players like you to test and see what will happen after hitting the "Play my code" button, but I'm not sure if I'm motivated enough to do that. I might do it if more people have the same demand. You can always create a pull request if you want to implement the feature yourself.

Thanks for the comment. In the "Victory Condition" section, the following text is stated:

"You have a larger domain (more accessible cells) than your opponent's."

And I think that's enough for the player to understand, and the word "conquered" is already intuitive enough.
Or do you mean the count of available moves for each player at each turn ?
Exactly.

Do you mean Up/Down/Left/Right ?  If the player can only move Up then the count is 1?  If you mean total locations they can reach on this turn, that may be useful.  But if you mean total number of squares they could eventually reach given the current board, it will be the same for both players until the game ends.

If your opponent last action has x = -1, you have the first turn. If not, then not. I see no issue. I remember multiple boardgames with the same method. 

If you mean it should be outside the game loop (before the while loop), then sure, but that's an aesthetic/style issue, it does not matter for gameplay.
True. It's more a convenience for beginners who can get easily confused than anything else.
I use the id as an array index to access initial/current positions
Still late at the party with a purely random bot. At least the game engine works.

@MSmits, I'd be very interested to know how important it is to have the first move if that is something you could tell from running your bot against itself.  You mentioned that it is deterministic mostly, so probably your current bot isn't the best at calculating this stat

Yes that is exactly the problem. It is fully deterministic. The only thing I could do is run a meta mcts. Then it would play different games because of building a base tree. I have done this before for games. However, it takes a lot of time to code a meta mcts and a lot of cpu time to run it.

Maybe if we have a few more good bots on the board we could get a better sense of this.

I am not *too* worried about player 1 having a game deciding advantage though. Games seem very different and fluid. But again... more good bots will help!
Yep, I got that, but I just figured you'd want to make the default move legal

If you perform the error checking while parsing the input, it should not be that ugly. Usually, game designers generate a list of valid moves. If the input does not match anything in the list, you have an error
This is actually good advice. This is my second game, and I'm still getting the hang of the design patterns, thanks.
If it can be of any help, the source code of my own games is available here (https://github.com/darkhorse64)

> The directions are not really necessary
>> I emphasize on the steps because of walls, there will be cases where the cell seem to be within 3-step Manhattan distance yet still unreachable due to a wall blocking it.
I still believe the directions are not necessary because the wall blocking rule applies no matter you talk about directions or Manhattan distance. The player should read the instructions as a whole, instead of focusing on individual sentences. I highly recommend to remove the notion of directions here to remove confusion with the direction of building a wall.

For the other question I'll have a think first.

How about this:
During a player's turn, the player may either keep their token in its current location, or move it to another cell up to 3 steps away (measured in Manhattan distance). There must be an unobstructed path (not blocked by any wall) to be able to move to the new location.

Thank you for following up ðŸ˜‰

Rules - Movements
* Please add "A token cannot be moved outside the board, or to a cell occupied by the other player's token."

Rules - Game over condition
* Please change "cell" to "cells". You may also consider adding "(domain)" after "cells".

* With reference to the scenario you mentioned, my suggested wording is:

Note that a player does not lose simply because their token is surrounded by 3 walls and blocked by the other player's token on the fourth side.

Defeat Condition
* Please change "less" to "fewer".

Output
* As mentioned, please delete "after moving to x y" because a token may not necessarily move.

Thanks.

One more fix for more clarity.

Rules - Movements
* Please change "(not blocked by any wall)" to "(not blocked by any wall or the other player's token)".

Sorry for any inconvenience caused, and thanks.

For the "scenario", I just realise that I'm just confusing myself, and already found a better way of wording, which is the current one. For the "cell" to "cells", I actually mean it that way, the win condition is determined by whether one player can reach the cell the other player is CURRENTLY standing at. By mentioning this it automatically clears the confusion of the "scenario" because in the scenario the player can still reach each other.

TLDR, as long as an unobstructed path exist between two players, the game continues.

The other corrections should be done, hopefully I didn't miss any, thanks again.
OK, makes sense to me. I don't see other issues right now; thank you too!
Please let me know when you've finalised the latest changes and I can review the contribution again. Thank you.
I have finalised the latest changes, you may now review the contribution again, thanks in advance.

OK, just a few minor changes:

The Goal
* Please change "domain, the one" to "domain. The player".

Wall building
* Suggest to change "walk" to "pass".

Game over condition
* Please change "splits" to "split".

* Please change "both" to "the".

Victory condition
* Please change "opponent" to "opponent's".

Defeat condition
* Please change "smaller" to "a smaller".

* Please change "provided" to "provides".

* Please change "opponent" to "opponent's".

Output
* Please add "." after "R".

Thanks.
Updated, thanks.
